thread.title: 9 crazy stats which suggest this season's Last 16 was the best ever round of Champions League football
thread.title_full: 9 crazy stats which suggest this season's Last 16 was the best ever round of Champions League football

author: Richard Innes
title: 9 crazy stats which suggest this season's Last 16 was the best ever round of Champions League football
text:
9 crazy stats which suggest this season's Last 16 was the best ever round of Champions League football This Last 16 of the 2016/17 Champions League gave us drama, craziness and some genuinely outstanding football Share Some all-time classics - all played in the same round (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Comebacks, dramatic victories, unbelievable twists and turns… the last 16 of this season's Champions League was a LOT of fun. 
As well as Barcelona's heroics against PSG, we had Arsenal's collapse against Bayern Munich, Leicester's fairytale continuing and goals - lots and lots of goals. 
In fact, there is an argument that this round of action might be the finest in Champions League history - as these stats suggest… 1. There were more goals in this season's Last 16 than in any previous Champions League Last 16. Most goals in Champions League Last 16 62 48 2004/05 2. Barcelona became the first side in European Cup history to overturn a four-goal deficit from the first leg. (Photo: AFP) 3. Man City became the first team in Champions League history to be eliminated in a knockout tie after scoring five goals in the first leg. (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 4. Leicester City became just the 50th team to reach the Champions League quarter-finals. (Photo: Plumb Images) 5. Arsenal became the first side to lose five consecutive home knockout ties in the Champions League. (Photo: PA) 6. Arsene Wenger’s side suffered the joint second-heaviest aggregate defeat in Champions League history (2-10), and the heaviest for an English team. (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 7. The second leg against Bayern was the first time Arsenal have conceded five goals at home in nearly two decades. The last time was November 1998 (a 5-0 loss v Chelsea in the League Cup). (Photo: Clive Mason) 8. Kasper Schmeichel became the first goalkeeper in Champions League history to save a penalty in both legs of a knockout tie. (Photo: REUTERS) 9. And finally… Gianluigi Buffon (the world's best goalkeeper for the last two decades) and Zinedine Zidane (the manager of the reigning European champions) both said Leicester - the team in 15th place in the Premier League - are the team to avoid in the last eight. Here's hoping the quarter-finals can live up to this standard… poll loading Was Barcelona 6-1 PSG the greatest Champions League match ever? 3000+ VOTES SO FAR
